column7: Do all peoples view neighboring or distant populations as radically different "Others," or can humans create mutual images based on a notion of shared humanity? Course compares and analyzes the range of images of ethnic, "racial," gender, class, and bodily differences that have been enacted historically and cross-culturally in both Western and non-Western populations. Prerequisite: A previous course in history and/or one of the social sciences suggested.
column9: Prerequisite: A previous course in history and/or one of the social sciences suggested.
column10: Advanced Composition, Humanities - Hist & Phil, and Cultural Studies - Western course.
